Live shot at Union County Performing Arts Center Rahway, NJ
Peace of Woodstock
Peace of Woodstock a Woodstock Tribute Band
[if lt IE 9]><script>document.createElement('video');</script><![endif]
https://peaceofwoodstock.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/05/ENCORE.mp4
Peace of Woodstock as of December 31st 2023 POW has performed 300 shows!
For tech info contact Brad Trumbull
813-317-4256 or keystrumbull@gmail.com
For bookings contact
gerry@williamclare.com (west coast)
craig@williamclare.com (east coast)
srgvpmedia@aol.com (Georgia, North and South Carolina)
info@tedfass.com (gail..Entertainment Unlimited..northeast)
rich@maximumbands.com
Follow us on Facebook¬†https://www.facebook.com/search/top/?q=peace%20of%20woodstock
Peace of Woodstock
Jennifer Torres-vocals, guitar, percussion and keys
Brad Trumbull-vocals, keys and guitar
Carl Peachey-vocals, guitar
Alvaro Torres-bass and vocals
Brent Martin-drums
‚Äì
Hi! I work at Grateful Days in Dahlonega and I met some of you in the store that day! I went to the show at the Holly Theater and I just wanted to say that I loved your performance! It was absolutely wonderful! I brought my roommate and another friend and we were all vibing. I adored the outfits on stage and the music was just astonishing. You all did a great job and we had such a fun time! Thank you so much for inviting me!
Peace
Gracie Ray
‚ÄúPeace of Woodstock gave our audience a night of awesome music that brought back so many memories for those in the crowd. Many came in their favorite 1960‚Äôs fashions. With the first song, the crowd was on their feet singing and dancing.‚Äù
Tami Mayhugh ‚Äì General Manager ‚Äì Ritz Theatre ‚Äì Toccoa, GA
‚Äì
Author: Robert Ziarko
Comment:
Band did two shows in one night to raise money for a children‚Äôs charity at the Savannah Center in the Villages Fl. They ROCKED !!¬† Yes it‚Äôs a 55+ community, you would not have known it that night. Absolutely FANTASTIC. Thank you! One of the BEST bands to play the Village‚Äôs. Each member is so talented and kind. Loved having them! You‚Äôll be back!
rom
Mary Goulston
from Military Museum in Punta Gorda
You were fabulous tonight. We so enjoyed your performance. Thank you for a great night!
From: Sharon Skeele-Hogan
Sent: Wednesday, May 06
Subject: RE: PEACE OF WOODSTOCKThey were FANTASTIC!
High Quality Musicianship
I felt this was far more than a tribute
‚Ä¶ it was performed as an homage to the music of Woodstock,
crafted and performed with the love and joy of that era.
On a side note: The lead singer completely channeled Janis Joplin.¬†guys ROCK!!!!!¬† Thank you so much.
Douglas W. Anderson, CCM/CAM ¬†¬†General Manager/Chief Operating Officer¬†Turtle Creek Club
You guys were outstanding!
Thank you for a great show! Carrollwood Cultural Center
Oh..god‚Ä¶it was so cool..Yes it was extremely special. Because I was there in 1969‚Ä¶‚Ä¶¬†Kerry Mitchell
From
Mitzi kann
on
good night
This band recently played at wellington Ampitheater and they were one of the best concerts we saw there!!! Love them‚Ä¶
Dear Brad and Band,
Thank you so much for giving us a wonderful evening to remember last night!
It brought back a lot of memories for most of us in the crowd (there were a few young‚Äôuns).
I loved watching you all play your instruments so professionally (I used to play acoustic guitar and piano)
and the vocals were great.
The slides and background info added to the fun, as well as your outfits and ours. We tried to be 1969
stylish!
It was a pleasure working with you.
Keep on rockin‚Äô!
Musically yours,
Joyce Kantrowitz
Villaggio NCJW
George Watt
says:
May 28, 2021 at 12:00 am
Best Woodstock tribute band I‚Äôve ever seen and heard.Class act.
Jen also does Gracie Slick impressions that will raise goosebumps!!
Brad, thanks so much for the shout out to my wife for our 34th anniversary last night.¬† It made a fun night even better!
A post from the Tybee Post Theater on Tybee Island: ¬†Last Friday the talented tribute band Peace of Woodstock grace the Tybee post to a sold out ¬†performance of there 1969 show: music of Woodstock! Yet the real story unfolds 3 years back with one of our volunteers of the year, Donna Collet. When the band first visited 3 years ago bought a band shirt and wore it while she danced and sang the night away! Post show the band expressed gratitude and all signed the back of the shirt. This friday Donna wore the signed shirt to their performance, Jen noticed and invited her back stage, revealing the sad news that there long time guitarist Bill had passed away in April. Touched by the loss and seeing the band showing each other that Bill had signed it Donna presented the shirt back to the band turning sorrow into a heartfelt tribute
Glad to see an ‚Äúold rocker‚Äù still rocking!¬† I was especially¬†impressed with your solo rendition of Beginnings (well, Jen sang harmony).
And I didn‚Äôt think Jen could pull off Janis, but her best song of the night was Piece of my heart ‚Äì she nailed it!
thanks to you and Fred, Jen, Alvaro (the silent partner) and Brent!
Joe Thomas
‚Äì
Some comments from Athens Theater in Delano Fl
9 A very fun time. Band was great and the theater is very comfortable.
It was a 10. we Loved it
10 Great fun and memories
Excellent show!¬† Amazing musicians too.¬† Definitely a 10!!
Amazing show
10! Loved it! My party of 4 had a blast!
Definitely a 10 ¬† It was fantastic
It was a 10+. ¬†Loved it!
We Loved it !!
10 out of 10 on Santana and Janis Joplin. Thanks for the memories!
Definitely 10
Woodstock gets a 10! Loved the entire show, especially Grace Slick, Janis Joplin, and Santana. I‚Äôd see it again!
10 I really liked it. The woman who sang Janis Joplin was fantastic
10 They put on a great show. Their dress coordinating with the pictures was Awesome. Lots of energy and pulling the crowd into participate.
The BAND.. all of you Bill, Brent, Alvaro, Jen, and You.. Superstars in my view.
Bill- MR. Guitar all the way and excellent vocals
Jen- Beautiful, Flowing, Peaceful, Calm, multi-talented musician: good to have on Center Stage..
Alvaro- rockin with the BASS sounds
Brent‚Äî keep the BAND on track¬† and with the beat..great drumming skills
YOU- Positive influence, multi talented, fun loving, gentle‚Ä¶. pulls it all together
Nice touch with a CHICAGO Classic with only acoustic guitars and fine voices
Rollin STones‚Äî strutt like a Roster‚Ä¶. well done
Your SHOWs are outstanding with the Musical Talent, Song Selections, and the Outfits‚Ä¶ and fun attitudes..
Phil
Just wanted to thank the band for a great show despite the¬†inclement weather‚Ä¶as you are well aware, even the original event had to deal with some weather issues.¬† I enjoyed seeing Peace of Woodstock at Skippers Smokehouse a few years back and was delighted to see a concert scheduled practically in my own backyard.¬† I was only 8 years old in 1969 but I did get to chat up a few concertgoers on Friday who were there in 69‚Äînot surprisingly, the music still resonates so much with us all these years later.
Thanks for a great show and hope to see you all again sometime soon.
Jeff
Had a blast at your Rhythm on the River Show. Unlike many tribute bands that present a mediocre performance with the knowledge that people who loved a particular band will be content just to hear some facsimile of their old favorites, Peace of Woodstock does a multitude of artists VERY WELL!
Mike Veeman
saw these guys in Port Charlotte last night‚Ä¶.Was a great show they all perform well‚Ä¶..Brought back some cool memories
I went to your concert. I was also at the original Woodstock. Your performance brought it all back. Your efforts, commitment and your talent is so appreciated.¬† If you weren‚Äôt there, you are there‚Ä¶. every time you perform. It was what you would of imagined.
2 sisters who were at Woodstock with original tickets
Woodstock was so amazing all consuming and could never be duplicated.¬† It was such a special time in my life. I couldn‚Äôt make it backup to Bethel New York for this weekend, I‚Äôm glad and grateful that I spent a small part of it with you.
When I heard you perform., you gave me so much joy and I thank you for it.
Kerry Mitchell
What a success it was. The membership had a ball, thanks to the energy of your band.
Saw them last night at Pinellas Park, Florida Performing Arts Center, great show, full house!! Jen Torres does the best Janis Joplin cover I‚Äôve ever seen, bar none, AMAZING! Janis would love her impression!! Would have been worth twice the price just to see that!!
From
Jane Morse
Hey Peace of Woodstock, We love you guys! I will see you in Jacksonville!
We heard such wonderful feedback. We love you guys and hope to have you here again next year!!! Kings Gate Port Charlotte
Saw the tribute show last night and it was great! The band works so hard to re-create the crazy days and music of Woodstock. Thanks for your hard work and effort. WOW!!! Tom Marengo
We saw your show at Carrollwood Cultural Center Thursday. This was our second year in a row attending the CCC show and I think this year was even better than last year, and you blew out socks off last year, so that‚Äôs saying something! You are fantastic! God bless!
A Peace of Woodstock comes to the Athens Aug. 21
Saw you guys in Seminole City Park, you were awesome‚Ä¶the guitarist incredible‚Ä¶memories of Hendrix‚Ä¶such great music‚Ä¶keep on rockin‚Äù Leslie A Scott
I had the opportunity to enjoy them in early 2019 in Sebring. This is a show not to miss. The consumate professionals. Brad, Bill . Jen Alvaro and my drummer pal Brent.
Rock on gang
All the best in Canada
Bob
Nothing Short of Fantastic
I was fortunate to have gone to the original Woodstock concert while in my 2nd year of college. I was 1 of 2 people in the audience tonight that had gone.
I started crying when I heard the songs being sung. I could close my eyes and imagine I was there again; after all these years!
The original Woodstock changed my life! Listening tonight was a special time. I definitely recommend this very talented band as they bring to life the historical one- of-a- kind event.
My wife and I saw your show at Reunion Resort, Kissimee,Fl. Great show. We were Not at the original Woodstock as we had a baby one month prior which made 2 kids. This show was as we had been told and what we read. Loved it. Thank You to all the band and their support members.
This band of professionals were spot on in both music and performance. True pros and it showed. From the first song set, to the final encore, it was true pleasure, awesome may be a better adjective. Every member not only made crucial plusses to the overall performance, but individually were top of the line musicians. Can‚Äôt wait to see them again. You can‚Äôt help but get taken in to the performance and back 50 years ago! Bob Chapman
We were at ¬†your concert on Saturday at Citrus Springs.¬† My wife and I want you all to know how much we enjoyed it. ¬† ¬† Bob Gonciarz
I almost don‚Äôt like to post anything because my cell phone doesn‚Äôt begin to show the talent in this band. To call them a cover band doesn‚Äôt begin to do them justice. I kept thinking, ‚ÄúWho are these people and how is it that I am able to go to their concert?!‚Äù Each and every member of the group is a major talent. Thank you
Brad Trumbull
for letting me know about this. You are the real deal.
‚Äî
Blew us away at Wynmoor ! Guitarist shredded Carlos Santana !!! Eyes closed could not tell the difference. Awesome tributes and especially love my girl Janice Joplin. GREAT Band !!!
from Kathy
http://www.fox13news.com/news/local-news/pasco-county-group-recreates-woodstock-experience-50-years-later
Hey, 70s songwriter here.¬† I went to ACP (Atlantic City Pop) just before Woodstock.¬† to summarize my cousin & I got tickets to Woodstock there.¬† We told the parents (since we were vacationing in OC New Jersey ) that we were going fishing but we‚Äôre gonna go to Woodstock.
Well, my cousin left his ticket on a night able by his bed where my uncle found it and promptly concluded our ‚Äòfishing trip‚Äô was a hoax and got us both grounded¬† and tore his ticket up.
Well, we never got to Woodstock but did see all the bands at ACP even more. So I felt like I saw Woodstock in a different place. The nice thing about the whole chain of events was that I never use my Woodstock ticket and I hung on to it with all my other ticket stubs from concerts back in the day. So I‚Äôve still got my unused Woodstock ticket which I had professionally preserved and a few other tickets from great concerts back then.
I like the 60s so much I started writing music in 1970 and actually finished the song in 71 called , ‚ÄúStuck in the ‚Äô60s‚Äù.
The song was so well liked I decided to start writing some more songs during my high school years. I ended up writing four albums of music that never got released. If you play my link above you‚Äôll get an idea of what it sounds like. You‚Äôll immediately hear the influences and the music
To this day I still play and right and I‚Äôve got material enough to release albums for quite some time. The only problem is recruiting new musicians to play the music since my bandmates have all passed on.
Anyway, looking forward to seeing your show if I can make it in my 72 beetle!
I hope you enjoyed my little trip here of a story and will love to meet you guys!
Righteous righteous fight the good fight!
Your fellow hippie,
Ray Ray B
‚Äî
GREAT SHOW!
This is Gary with Hidden Treasure.¬† I wanted to thank you guys for such a great show at our flagler beach location during bike week. ¬†I heard nothing but great things.¬† I was wondering if you had April 27th, 2019 available for 6-10 show.¬† We would love to¬† book a few shows with you guys.
From:
Scott <
scottn@webs410.com
>
Love the band Peace of Woodstock. Seen you play at Skipper‚Äôs, etc. Appreciate the time you‚Äôve put into putting on a show.
Peace of Woodstock ‚Äì 2 Thumbs Up!
Talk about a time trip! Excellent show! Richard Dabinett
The Woodstock buzz is amazing and I‚Äôm pretty sure it will be for a time to come. On behalf of Lamplighter Village, thank you for making our event a huge success!
Sue, Great show at the Cascades in Estero, Fl! My kind of music!!!!!!!
This band is incredible! So much talent. Every member is fantastic. Thanks
Brad Trumbull
. I‚Äôm so glad we were able to see the show!
‚Äì
Peace Of Woodstock, even better than I expected and I expected greatness.
‚Äî
Horst Geyer
‚Äî¬†THEY GET BETTER AND BETTER DON‚ÄôT THEY
‚Äî
Wow! It‚Äôs always neat to hear folks in the audience say, ‚Äúwow they are great! Well ‚ÄúPeace
‚úåüèº
of Woodstock you did it again! You always give 150%!
‚Äì
Sandra Steele Kubler
‚Äî
Oh, it was amazing. I couldn‚Äôt even sleep after that show!
‚Äì
Denice Cummings
‚Äé
to
Peace of Woodstock
WOW! That‚Äôs all we can say! Thanks for rocking the house down tonight!
‚Äî
‚Äî
Peace, Love, and Rock & Roll Concert
Benefiting The Florida Holocaust Museum
June 29 at 7:00 p.m.
at The Florida Holocaust Museum
Bill Graham and the Rock & Roll Revolution
will close on June 30th. Join us in celebrating the life of this legendary promoter and Holocaust refugee with one last special event! A live concert by Peace of Woodstock, who will perform their 90-minute Woodstock Tribute Show.
In August rockatnight.com did an interview with peace of woodstock before the Hard Rock Cafe gig
Bill Adam
February 9 at 12:19 pm
You guys were simply fantastic and I am looking forward to seeing you again soon.
Carolyn
February 8 at 6:15 pm
Saw your act last year at the Largo Cultural Center
CAN‚ÄôT WAIT TO SEE YOU ALL AGAIN TONIGHT ! !
From the Lions Club:¬†Peace of Woodstock performed 2 shows February 8th to nearly sold out crowds. The audience cheered and loved the songs from woodstock! Thank you guys we will want you back
Kenneth
February 11 at 11:13 pm
I saw the Largo afternoon show. I felt like I was home‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ I was very impressed and ‚ÄúTook that Journey‚Äù way back. You guys sounded great!!!
Peace, Love and the Spirit of Giving
Carrollwood Cultural Center:
Thanks You,Thank you, Peace of Woodstock performed a musical tribute to Woodstock to a full house.
This event was definitely special.
Something very beautiful about the ‚ÄúWoodstock Generation‚Äù!
THANK YOU!
Me and my wife caught Peace of Woodstock at the Carrollwood Cultural Center.. Fantastic, the show, the costumes, Jen was great. Thanks you thank you thank you!!!!!!
From Carrollwood Cultural Center
‚ÄúTo our friends with Peace of Woodstock:
Thank YOU for a great show! ‚Äù
Horst Geyer,
WHAT A SHOW All your musician buddies were just liking their chops Brad It was so good! The lead guitar did a great Hendrix star spangled Can he go it LEFT HANDED!!! Just kidding I‚Äôm glad I experienced Peace of Woodstock!
Julie Berry at Skipper‚Äôs Smokehouse,
Peace of Woodstock! Awesome talent on a gorgeous night!
Kat
Submitted on 2016/04/15 at 3:01 am
Hey we just saw your show at Caliente tonight and it was absolutely the best I‚Äôve experienced in a long time!. I would love to LIKE your page and get updates on your shows! We definitely want to see you again! Thank you for being so awesome!!! I wouldn‚Äôt change a single thing, it was perfect!!!
PEACE!!!
Michael Szklarz
Submitted on 05/15 at 5:50 pm
You folks did a phenomenal job last evening
You are an inspiration to the memory of Woodstock. It was a time when music was music.
Diane O‚ÄôBrien
Submitted on 2016/05/15 at 12:31 pm
Thank you for an outstanding performance last night. Prayers for all of you. God Bless.
Janice
Submitted on 05/15 at 2:40 am
We were at the show tonight at top of the world. ¬†You all were great!!!!!!!
Joy R White
Thank you for a wonderful concert.
Submitted on05/16 at 5:35 pm
Saturday night was the second time my wife and I have seen you in Ocala. You all were extremely professional ¬†Rock On!
Gina
We truly enjoyed your show, thank you for a wonderful time. Nam Myoho Renge Kyo!
Dennis Hall- Very talented group of musicians ..CSN was my favorite with JJ‚Ä¶
Love note for note bands.. Nailed it!
Patsy Kennington Craven Great night!!! Fantastic musicians!!!
Diana Snedeker soooooooooooo much fun!!!!! Great music by very talented musicians.
Frankie Cross- An amazing night! Extremely talented people.
Robin Rothwell- Great show!!! I was staggered!!! Great guitar playin‚Äô Billy!!!!
Darcy Geders
June 20 at 10:02am
We were WOWED last night at this performance and so happy we came! They got me so enthused and pumped up, I couldn‚Äôt sleep when I got home! A great group of mega talented musicians who have worked hard for this result. I loved it and can‚Äôt wait to see them again!!! Oh, and Jen absolutely nailed Janis‚Ä¶ I about fell out.
The show was exceptional and everyone can not stop raving about it! Hope you and the rest enjoy the remainder of the summer! ¬† ¬† ¬†Patrick Starega ¬†General Manager ¬†U.C.P.A. C.
Aaron Ellison- AMAZING
james c
Saw these guys & gal last night at Cypress Cove. I was having flashbacks even though I never got closer than 50 miles away from Bethel that weekend, & totally by accident.
I saw your performance at the Palm Pavilion on Friday July 15th, along with my brother that was here from Kentucky, we absolutely loved it. I didn‚Äôt sit down one time and danced the night away. Looking forward to catching another performance.
Lynn
caribliku@yahoo.com
We saw your concert at the Port Charlotte Convention Center, all I can say is AWESOME!!!! What a great time we had listening to this group.
Hi Brad and Scott,
Hope all is well! I just wanted to reach out and tell you all once again how great you were at the Marion County Go Red For Women event on March 10. Our guests had such a great time and enjoyed every minute of it. Thank you for being so flexible with everything and putting your thought into making it a meaningful time. Scott, thank you also for taking the time to share your inspirational story. I know it touched a lot of people there and put a face to the work the American Heart Association does
Diane (Dee) Sammarco
Last night, Aug 18 th, eight of us went to see your show in Deland Florida. It was awesome !!! Everyone of the performers were so good, y‚Äôall had us up and dancing at our seats!!! We had a great time , thank you so much for a great night . Thanks again‚Ä¶.Diane
At the Athens show in Deland, FL the venue asked to rate the show from 1-5
The show was wonderful! A 5 for excellence.¬†Not a 5 a 10!!!! But a 5 if that‚Äôs your top number! it was AMAZING!!!
Hi, the vocals were just great!! When I closed my eyes I thought I was listening to the actual musicians‚Ä¶.especially Janice Joplin. All of them harmonized so well together. And the lead guitarist‚Ä¶.fabulous! It was a wonderful walk down memory lane!!! Thank you!!
We enjoyed the Peace of Woodstock show. I give it 5 High energy, fun, they did work very hard.
A 5 all the way, a most excellent show would go again tonight if they were performing again. You know I watched there short videos online before I went and I didn‚Äôt think to much of them, man was I wrong don‚Äôt let that fool you these guys and girls rock!
Hello everyone! What a great Geckofest, in spite of the short rainout! There has been SO MUCH positive feedback about the entertainment. Everyone is saying that this was the best Geckofest ever, and that‚Äôs because of all of you.So, thank you from the bottom of my heart! I hope that we will have an opportunity to book you again along the way somewhere. It was a pleasure to work with you.
Susan Blankenship¬†SIK Promotions, Inc. ¬†Custom Festival Management
Theresa Moulder
tmoulder58@yahoo.com
Saw your performance at Top of The World Cultural Center on 9/16/17. We really enjoyed the show and the fantastic group of performers, as well as the fantastic show. Peace.
What a great show last Friday evening at the winery in Ft Pierce! Your group is terrific!
Regards.
John Chianis
I was at the Peace of Woodstock Show at Trilogy Orlando on March 24th, the band was unbelievable. I especially liked the acoustic portion where you sang Darling Be Home Soon by John Sebastian. Also like the Big Brother and Holding Company (with Janis Joplin) tribute. Do not see Piece of My Heart played that much but your lead singer was unbelievable. Thanks for a great show.
David Shumway
